intro: Casearia integrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf casearia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically smooth-edged. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, round fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value and medicinal properties make it a notable species in botanical studies.
